item.title: Getting started with Arch Linux
item.description: Warranty Disclaimer: I am not responsible for data loss, possible hardware failures, thermonuclear war, or you getting fired because your arch driven atomic plant failed. If you have any concerns regarding the installation don’t hesitate to do some research on your own to prevent possible failures or bugs. After booting the arch iso you’ll will have to proceed with the following steps: Prerequisites: A working Arch Linux boot stick sudo dd if=<path-to-image.

item.title: Programming a GH60
item.description: I recently wanted to update my keyboards layout and thought it was a good opportunity to come with a guide since many friends keep asking me how to flash their keyboard on Linux. In this case I am requiring an Atmel-based PCB as we’re using DFU-Programmer which is developed for Atmel-Microcontrollers. But there is a good chance, that you have one in your keyboard as well since they are the most popular manufacturer for micro controllers.
